During the meeting, the group discussed the technical and functional designs, prototype presentation, detailed design, and specific designing requirements of the remote control. In the meeting, the group discussed several aspects of the design for the remote control. They made conclusions on the use of LCD screens, speech recognition, screen usage, spin wheel with LCD display, and the FPGA in the industrial working design. 

Regarding the LCD screens, they mentioned the possibility of using them for the display on the remote control. However, they also discussed the need for a more advanced chip if they were to incorporate an LCD display, which may not be feasible within their budget. 

They also discussed the energy source for the remote control and concluded that using kinetic energy would be a good option. They liked the idea of shaking the remote control to generate power and felt it would be innovative and energy-saving. They also mentioned the possibility of using solar power as a backup energy source. 

In terms of the casing, they decided to use a combination of plastic and rubber. They felt that rubber would be more comfortable and ideal for anti-RSI (repetitive strain injury) purposes. They also discussed the option of using interchangeable plates to allow for customization and different colors. 

In terms of the user interface, they discussed the importance of a simple and user-friendly design. They mentioned the possibility of using graphical user interface elements but ultimately decided to go with a command line interface for simplicity. They also discussed the importance of keeping the number of buttons to a minimum and focusing on the basic functions like power, volume, and channel control. 

Lastly, they discussed the trend of using fruits and vegetables as a theme in design. While they found it a bit strange, they decided to explore a more abstract approach to incorporate elements of fruits and vegetables in the design. They also mentioned the possibility of incorporating animal-based designs for future face-plates. 

Overall, the group made decisions on various aspects of the remote control design, taking into consideration factors such as budget, user-friendliness, and current design trends.
